title: John Heitinga - Wikipedia
snippet: John Gijsbert Alan Heitinga (born 15 November 1983) is a Dutch football coach and former player who was most recently the head coach of Eredivisie club Ajax. A product of the Ajax Academy, he played for their first squad from 2001 to 2008. After a one-year spell at Atlético Madrid in Spain, ...

title: John Heitinga appointed head coach of Ajax
snippet: After years in the youth academy, hundreds of matches for Ajax’s first team, various coaching roles at the De Toekomst training complex, and a stint as assistant coach with Jong Ajax, he now embarks on his second spell as the club’s head coach. ... Technical Director Alex Kroes is pleased with the appointment of John Heitinga as Ajax’s new head coach.

title: Heitinga: back in Mokum, back at 'his' Ajax
snippet: Heitinga quickly rose through the ranks of the famed academy and, during the 1998/1999 season, played in the B1 team under coach John van 't Schip alongside teammates like Maarten Stekelenburg and Rafael van der Vaart.

title: Liverpool assistant manager John Heitinga appointed Ajax head coach - The Athletic
snippet: Heitina made 218 first-team appearances over two spells at Ajax and moved into coaching after retiring in 2016, working as coach of Jong Ajax — their youth side which competes in the second-tier of Dutch football — for 18 months before his ...

title: John Heitinga head coach of Ajax for rest of season
snippet: His commitment to Ajax runs until June 30, 2025. Last weekend, Heitinga (Alphen aan den Rijn, November 15, 1983) functioned as interim head coach during the victorious match against Excelsior (1-4).
